newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat ends lower on technical slide.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat ends lower on technical slide.

text.p: CBOT wheat futures closed lower on a technical slide, with a near free fall in soybean futures also weighing on the market, traders said.
Pressure also came from persistent worldwide competition for wheat export business with traders also citing the U.S/Iraqi conflict as a mildly bearish factor.
"People are keeping an eye on it but it's not considered a big deal yet," said Ron Kucha of O'Connor and Co.
U.S. air strike against Iraq this week was seen as potentially disrupting international trade and could lead to a modest near-term snarl on shipments of wheat to the Mideast.
Wheat futures volume was estimated at 14,000 contracts, down from 17,043 Tuesday.
In wheat options, Refco Inc bought 600 December $4.40 puts and sold 600 December $4.20 puts at 7-3/8 cents.
Wheat options volume was estimated at 3,500 contracts, up from 3,278 Tuesday.
Wheat closed three to five cents per bushel lower, with September down 3-1/2 at $4.49.
